This guide explains how to implement ser: This guide explains how to implement service classes that handle CRUD operations in MBC CQRS Serverless. Services are the core of your business logic, coordinating between controllers, commands, and data access.

Important: Include the version field to: Important: Include the version field to enable optimistic locking and prevent concurrent update conflicts.
The `version` field in `publishPartialUp: The `version` field in `publishPartialUpdateAsync()` controls how the existing item is retrieved:
Uses the specified version number. The c: Uses the specified version number. The command will fail if the version doesn't match (optimistic locking).
Automatically retrieves the latest versi: Automatically retrieves the latest version using `getLatestItem()`.
Use `existing.version` (as shown above): Use `existing.version` (as shown above) for strict optimistic locking. Use `VERSION_LATEST` (-1) when you want to always update the latest version regardless of what version you have cached.

Why Soft Delete: Data is marked as delet: Why Soft Delete: Data is marked as deleted (isDeleted=true) rather than physically removed, preserving audit history.
